intro: Wiborgia fusca, commonly known as the dark wiborgia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish. Wiborgia fusca is often found in open grasslands and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
